page.title: 07TRADE IN CHITTERNE
page.content: Stables to train race horses have been established in Chitterne for over one hundred years and run as a commercial enterprise for over thirty years. There are facilities for twenty four horses. The only shop left in the village is a general store supplying everyday needs, daily papers and "local gossip" to the villagers; it also incorporates the sub-Post Office which moved in from other premises some years ago. A Warminster based milkman delivers milk, bread and dairy produce five times a week. In 1984 a resident started a metal workshop for welding, fabrications and repairs for home, farm, garden and industry. A large house takes a limited number of paying guests for bed and breakfast.
